definition: life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: One final characteristic of a lustful relationship is that it is typically short lived.
sentences.chinese: 最后，欲望关系的一大特征是短命。

sentences.english: It may be Spain's most short-lived public company.
sentences.chinese: 它可能是西班牙史上最短命的上市公司。

sentences.english: July 14 ghosts door open, short-lived starve not vegetarian dish called jai.
sentences.chinese: 七月十四鬼门开，短命饿死不吃斋。

sentences.english: The reign of "House Of Cards" may be short-lived.
He paid twenty francs for the cast-off garments.
sentences.chinese: 他出二十法郎买了那身短命衣。

sentences.english: This short-lived government only existed for 100 days.
sentences.chinese: 这个短命的政府只存在了100天。

sentences.english: The short life in private company for Lala’s career is over.
sentences.chinese: 拉拉在民营企业的职业生涯就这样短命地结束了。

sentences.english: Force is all-conquering, but its victories are short-lived.
sentences.chinese: 武力是可以什么都征服，但是它的胜利却是短命的。

sentences.english: But the country's experiment in democracy was to be short-lived.
sentences.chinese: 但是他在这个国家的民主实验是短命的。
三个反足细胞是短命的。

sentences.english: For a brief moment rebels set up a separatist government in Dusseldorf.
sentences.chinese: 叛军曾经在杜塞尔多夫建立了短命的分裂政府。

sentences.english: Finally, the fratricidal price wars led to the short-lived brand of Pharmaceuticals in China.
sentences.chinese: 最后，自相残杀的价格战导致中国药品品牌的短命。

definition: to die an untimely death (idiom)/to be cut off in one's prime
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
one's days are numbered/not to have long to live (often fig.)
to die young or prematurely/to come to a premature end/to be aborted prematurely
to transition to a new dynasty or regime
to be born under an unlucky star (usu. of women)/to be born unlucky
to be destroyed/to become extinct/to perish/to die out/to destroy/to exterminate
to decline/to die out/decline and fall
